abstract: Philippine officials report that military is battling Islamic militants in south, with recent fighting killing dozens and displacing more than 82,000 people from their homes; lawmakers are debating bill that would formalize peace deal reached year ago with Moro Islamic Liberation Front, country's largest rebel group.
lead_paragraph: The intensified fighting against Islamic militants is taking place as lawmakers in Manila are debating a bill that would formalize the provisions of a landmark peace deal reached a year ago with the country’s largest rebel organization.

headline.main: Refugee Crisis in Philippines as Peace Deal Is at Risk
headline.print_headline: Refugee Crisis in Philippines as Peace Deal Is at Risk

snippet: The intensified fighting against Islamic militants is taking place as lawmakers in Manila are debating a bill that would formalize the provisions of a landmark peace deal reached a year ago with the country’s largest rebel organization.
